Key Match Events: Ghana's best chance in the game fell to Antoine Semenyo in the sixth minute when Inaki Williams set him up one-on-one with the Comoros goalkeeper.
Comoros striker Myziane Maolida found the back of the net in the 43rd minute.
Ghana created a few chances in the game but were unlucky in front of goal as the Comoros goalkeeper remained resolute.
Post-Match Reflections: The Black Stars were handed a painful 1-0 defeat by Comoros in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers at Moroni on Tuesday, November 21, 2023.
With the results, Comoros went top of Group I with Mali and Madagascar in 2nd and 3rd place respectively.
Ghana is currently 4th with the Central African Republic and Chad in 5th and 6th place respectively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Stars returned from the break with coach Chris Hughton bringing on Mohammed Kudus to replace Andre Ayew.
Ernest Nuamah and Majeed Ashimeru were also introduced later in the match as Abdul Salis Samed and Antoine Semenyo were subbed off.
Others: Comoros dominated play from the on set and were very ambitious as they fired shots from wide areas.
